page.title: 01Daglingworth Area
page.content: The 12 square kilometre block we have studied includes the small rural communities of Duntisbourne Rouse, Middle Duntisbourne and the larger village of Daglingworth. Much of the farm land surrounding the villages belongs to the Duchy of Cornwall, and is farmed by tenant farmers. Part of the area is covered by the woodlands of Daglingworth Park, leading into the Estate of Cirencester Park which belongs to Lord Bathurst. These woodlands provide a valuable recreation area, and are open to the public who may walk or ride there. The villages consist mainly of old houses and cottages, built of the local limestone in tbe typical attractive Cotswold style. There are very few modern houses and no housing estates of any kind. _
